# Tutorial: Image Toolbar

<img align="top" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt=""><img align="top" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt="">

![](./0.jpg?raw=true "Optional Title")

If your image is RGB, select the channel to segment (e.g. ch1, 2 or 3). Note that all channel sensitive functions are indicated by a RGB icon.

<img align="top" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt="">

![](./1.jpg?raw=true "Optional Title")

Press this button after you add or remove a cell contact to update the image<ul><li>Note that this button does not save the image, so press 'save' if you want to store the changes</li><li>Pressing this button is equivalent to hitting 'Enter' on the keyboard</li></ul>

<img align="top" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt="">

![](./2.jpg?raw=true "Optional Title")

Controls the size of the TA pen (e.g. you can make it bigger to remove a lot of cells at the same time)

<img align="top" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt=""><img align="top" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt="">

![](./3.jpg?raw=true "Optional Title")

This button updates the image after addition or removal of cell contacts and also removes cells with an area less than the value in the spinner

<img align="top" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt="">

![](./4.jpg?raw=true "Optional Title")

This is a seeded watershed: to use it draw two or more dots/points in a continuous area before pressing this button. Once done missing contacts between seeds should be redrawn. This is a easy way to draw missing contacts, in just a few clicks.

<img align="top" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt="">

![](./5.jpg?raw=true "Optional Title")

Press this button to save drawn or removed contacts (otherwise changes will be ignored)

<img align="top" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt="">

![](./6.jpg?raw=true "Optional Title")

Press this to change the segmentation mask color

<img align="top" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt="">

![](./7.jpg?raw=true "Optional Title")

Enable this if you ran the recentering functions of TA

<img align="top" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt="">

![](./8.jpg?raw=true "Optional Title")

Quickly hide the segmentation mask to view pixels below it (may help you identify segmentation errors)

<img align="top" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt="">

![](./9.jpg?raw=true "Optional Title")

Pick a color on the image

<img align="top" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt="">

![](./15.jpg?raw=true "Optional Title")

Zoom +

<img align="top" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt="">

![](./10.jpg?raw=true "Optional Title")

Zoom -

<img align="top" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt="">

![](./11.jpg?raw=true "Optional Title")

Sets image magnification to 1X

<img align="top" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt=""><img align="top" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt="">

![](./12.jpg?raw=true "Optional Title")

Determines the optimal zoom to view the entire image

<img align="top" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt="">

![](./13.jpg?raw=true "Optional Title")

Alternates between best fit for width or height (try press it twice, if you don't understand)

<img align="top" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt="">

![](./14.jpg?raw=true "Optional Title")

Send the displayed image to the system clipboard (to paste it in another software later)
